definition: A short piece of writing on a particular subject.
example: I wrote an essay for my English class.

definition: A small unit of money, especially in the UK or the US.
example: I don't have a penny left.

definition: The feeling of being afraid.
example: She has a fear of heights.

definition: The activity of growing crops or raising animals.
example: Farming is very important in this region.

definition: To let someone do something.
example: My parents allow me to go out.

definition: To take something with the intention of giving it back.
example: Can I borrow your pen?

definition: Not pleasant to look at.
example: The building is old and ugly.

definition: On a lower floor of a building.
example: She is waiting downstairs.

definition: On or into a ship, plane, or vehicle.
example: We went aboard the ship.

definition: A large boat used for travel or transport.
example: The ship left the port early.

definition: Sleeping.
example: The baby is asleep.

definition: At a greater distance or more advanced.
example: We need further information.

definition: The top inside surface of a room.
example: The ceiling is very high.

definition: The sound of people laughing.
example: The room was full of laughter.

definition: To succeed in doing something after effort.
example: She achieved her goals.

definition: In the direction of something.
example: He walked towards the door.

definition: To move air or be moved by air.
example: The wind blows strongly today.

definition: An important or interesting part of something.
example: This phone has a new feature.

definition: Very surprising or impressive.
example: The view is amazing.

definition: The joint between the foot and the leg.
example: He hurt his ankle while running.

definition: The state of being very poor.
example: Many people live in poverty.

definition: Very bad or unpleasant.
example: The weather is awful today.

definition: To go up something using your hands and feet.
example: They climb the mountain every year.

definition: Something that will probably happen.
example: It is likely to rain.

definition: To have enough money to buy something.
example: I can't afford a new car.

definition: To make a sudden short sound or to appear suddenly.
example: The balloon will pop if you touch it.

definition: The first meal of the day.
example: I usually have coffee and toast for breakfast.

definition: A piece of furniture with shelves for storing things.
example: The plates are in the cupboard.

definition: To lift something to a higher position or take care of someone while they grow.
example: She raised her hand to ask a question.

definition: To make something full.
example: Please fill the glass with water.

definition: Having a great height.
example: He is very tall for his age.

definition: To include something as a necessary part or result.
example: This job involves working with people.

definition: The period of being a child.
example: She had a happy childhood.

definition: Used to express future actions or strong intentions (formal).
example: We shall meet again.

definition: To achieve something desired or promised.
example: He fulfilled his dream of becoming a teacher.

definition: On or onto a ship, plane, or vehicle.
example: Welcome aboard the train.

definition: In place of something else.
example: I didn’t take the bus; I walked instead.
